thread.title: Kentucky F Derek Willis out two weeks with finger injury
thread.title_full: Kentucky F Derek Willis out two weeks with finger injury

author: Quaid taken into custody in Vermont trying to cross border
title: Kentucky F Derek Willis out two weeks with finger injury
text:
Kentucky F Derek Willis out two weeks with finger injury FOXSports 1 hr ago © Getty Images TUSCALOOSA, AL - JANUARY 17: Derek Willis #35 of the Kentucky Wildcats attempts a layup over Rodney Cooper #21 of the Alabama Crimson Tide during the game at Coleman Coliseum on January 17, 2015 in Tuscaloosa, Alabama. At halftime the Kentucky Wildcats leads the Alabama Crimson Tide 35-17. (Photo by Michael Chang/Getty Images) Kentucky head coach John Calipari has seen his second reserve go down this week, announcing that Derek Willis suffered a finger injury on his left hand during Saturday's practice.
"I’m happy that it’s not something that will keep Derek out very long, but I’m disappointed because I really wanted him to participate in tomorrow’s open practice,” Calipari said in a statement . “It’s nothing serious and he will be back in a couple weeks, but I’m disappointed for him because he had been doing so well. He deserved to show his stuff tomorrow. He’s made great strides and will bounce back from this.”
AdChoices Earlier this week, guard Dominique Hawkins broke a bone in his right hand. He is expected to miss a month. Willis could be back for the Blue-White Scrimmage on Oct. 27.
The 6-foot-9 forward has averaged 1.2 points per game through his first two seasons in Lexington.
Kentucky opens the 2015-16 season against Albany on Nov. 13.
